awd_titl_txt: Establishment of a Facility for 40Ar/39Ar and Other Noble   Gas Geochronology
awd_abstract_narration: This award will provide 45% of the funds required to                       purchase a noble-gas mass spectrometer and construct a low-blank                gas extraction system. Lehigh University will provide the                       remaining 55% and is pledged to supporting the necessary                        laboratory renovations in their Department of Geological Sciences               where the system will be housed and operated.                                        Planned research for the next several years includes                       theoretical studies aimed at providing a better understanding of                the argon 40/39 technique for dating rocks and minerals as well                 as applied research to exploit the technique to rock masses that                have undergone complex thermal histories.
